work.name: Token Metrics
work.summary: My responsibility as a Quantitative Analyst was creating and managing algorithmic trading strategies, enhancing the firm's trading infrastructure, developing risk management tools.
highlights: Spearheaded the development of the firm's flagship crypto trading strategy -- responsible for platform's buy/sell recommendations for 1500 tokens and brains behind trading bot -- with 83% of top-500 market cap tokens outperforming the benchmark (BTC hold) and 87% tokens w/ positive ROI in backtest across major market periods.

Managed the complete software development life-cycle for algorithmic trading strategies, from research and rapid prototyping to building, testing, and deploying robust, production-grade systems on live servers, ensuring high availability.

Led the initiative to upgrade firm's core market data from low to mid-frequency -- re-engineering the firm's legacy trading infrastructure -- enabling more sophisticated trading strategy generation and improving backtesting precision across all quantitative models.

Architected and built a framework of high-performance suite of Python-based internal tools, facilitating technical analysis, event-driven backtesting and performance-analytics reporting which reduced the strategy research-to-deployment cycle time by approximately 80%
Researched and validated novel alpha-generating strategies with a focus on capital preservation in volatile markets, enhancing portfolio resilience.

Revamped the proprietary crypto market indicator, improving the firm's ability to accurately assess bullish/bearish/neutral market regimes by overhauling the underlying model for token state analysis; this indicator later became a crucial component of the flagship trading strategy.

major revamp of the following key customer facing features into the Token Metrics web platform:
  • proprietary crypto market indicator (a key ingredient in the flagship trading strategy) by refining the constituents token dynamics and improving the accuracy of market status signals.
  • scenario based price forecast model, powered by combination of sophisticated token specific quantitative metrics and crypto market cap scenarios

work.name: Token Metrics
work.summary: My responsibility as a Quantitative Analyst was creating and managing indices.
highlights: Overhauled the Index rebalancing framework for In-house crypto indices by conceptualizing and implementing a sophisticated combination of Black Litterman and Mean Variance Optimization models incorporating proprietary token grades as investor views leading to significant increase in backtested risk adjusted returns while lowering the index turnover.

Enhanced risk management across existing trading strategies by designing and implementing dynamic stop-loss mechanisms to improve the strategy's ability to lock in profits and protect against sudden market reversals resulting in reduction in average drawdown by 11%.

Spearheaded the standardized cross-translation of trading strategies between PineScript and Python and created a version-controlled unified library of trading strategies, enabling systematic backtesting and integration into automated trading infrastructure.
